Senior Risk & Compliance Officer Job at Rainoil Limited




        
    

        
        Rainoil Limited is an integrated downstream oil and gas company. A prominent player in the Nigerian industry, the company’s operations span across the downstream value chain i.e. Petroleum Product Storage, Haulage/Distribution and Retail Sales. Our primary products include Petrol (PMS), Diesel (AGO) and Kerosene (DPK).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Risk & Compliance Officer

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Description
     

            
    




	Ability to develop & implement the enterprise Risk Management Framework.
	Ability to align standard operating procedures/business process with strategic objectives.
	Ability to deliver regular analysis reports to management & Board
	Ability to monitor the FX & credit position regularly.


Responsibilities


	Develop and implement the Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) framework.
	Identify, assess, and mitigate operational, financial, credit, market, and compliance risks.
	Ensure compliance with local and international regulatory requirements.
	Monitor changes in laws, regulations, and industry standards and update policies accordingly.
	Liaise with regulatory bodies, auditors, and external stakeholders.
	Develop and implement risk management and compliance policies, procedures, and controls.
	Conduct regular compliance audits and risk assessments.
	Provide regular reports on risk exposure, compliance status, and mitigation plans to senior management and the Board.
	Strengthen internal control systems to prevent fraud, misconduct, and regulatory breaches.
	Lead and oversee investigations into compliance violations and risk incidents.
	Conduct risk and compliance training to promote awareness and adherence.
	Foster a risk-aware culture across the organization.


Requirements


	Minimum of Second-class Upper Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Audit, Economics or related field.
	Minimum 5-10 years of experience in Internal Audit/Control or Risk & compliance from Oil & Gas/Banking or Insurance.
	The candidate should be ACA/ACCA qualified.

Legal Manager (Upstream) Job at Eni Nigeria




        
    

        
        Eni is one of the most important, vertically integrated energy companies in the world. It operates in the oil, natural gas, electricity production, engineering, construction and petrochemical products sectors. It is constantly working to build a future where everyone can access energy resources efficiently and sustainably.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Legal Manager (Upstream)

Job Reference #: 32130
Job Location: Abuja, Nigeria
Contract type: Permanent 

Job Description
     

            
    




	At Eni, we are looking for a Legal Manager (Upstream) within Nigerian Agip Exploration Ltd (NAE) in Abuja.
	You will be responsible for providing legal assistance, advice and support to NAE and Eni’s subsidiaries in Nigeria on contractual, administrative, judicial and extrajudicial matters, in accordance with applicable laws, as well as the policies, rules, and procedures established by the company.


Main Responsibilities


	Support all departments with timely advice on legal matters relating to contracts, licences, commercial agreements, portfolio management activities, governance, corporate secretarial matters, laws and regulations.
	Attend meetings with third parties and government authorities regarding NAE’s activities in Nigeria.
	Manage and engage on relevant legal issues with industry stakeholders and partners.
	Oversee legal representation and defence in disputes and litigation, including managing external legal providers and assessing the quality of their contributions.
	Liaise with external legal providers appointed by NAE and Eni’s subsidiaries in Nigeria, or in relation to NAE’s activities in Nigeria.
	Coordinate with Eni’s legal department at headquarters, ensuring prompt reporting of all material legal issues.
	Act in compliance with the Code of Ethics, SOA and Model 231.


Skills And Experience Required


	Degree in Law.
	Registered with the Nigerian Bar Association.
	Significant experience in a managerial position within the oil and gas industry.
	Strong knowledge of legal concepts within the upstream sector.
	Proven ability to provide strategic legal leadership.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Strong negotiation and stakeholder engagement skills, with sound judgement and professionalism.
	Fluent in English
